intro: Laurentia ramosissima, commonly known as the hairy willow or slender willow, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It is a member of the Salicaceae family, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its slender, often twining stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, and it is often found growing in moist, open habitats such as riverbanks and wet meadows. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Laurentia ramosissima is typically a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland environments.
